definition: to live (somewhere) for free
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Come to my house and you won't have to pay for anything.
sentences.chinese: 暑假你跟我回家，你就可以在我家白吃白住。

sentences.english: W3: I never have to pay for anything. Everywhere I go, I can stay and eat for free.
sentences.chinese: 我走到哪儿都不用花钱，白吃白住。

sentences.english: I told him to stop being a freeloader and get out and find another job.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉他不要继续白吃白住，到外面去再找一个工作。

definition: to freeload
to eat without paying/to eat for free
to eat without paying/to freeload
to freeload for food
to lodge
charges for a room/house rental
to live as a parasite/doing nothing to earn one's keep
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
to eat plain rice/(fig.) to eat and not pay for it/to sponge off others/to freeload
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
room charge in a hotel/accommodation expenses
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
rent/same as 租金
to avoid external disturbance in order to idle
to feel very apologetic
to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
